title: Leave Guidelines
summary: Guidance on leave types, eligibility, approvals and documentation.
body:
## Purpose
This policy defines how employees request and take leave, ensuring fairness, compliance, and business continuity.

## Leave Types
- **Annual leave:** Paid time off accrued monthly.
- **Sick leave:** For illness; medical certificate required if >2 days.
- **Emergency leave:** Unplanned urgent situations; manager notification ASAP.
- **Maternity/Paternity:** Per local law and company provisions.
- **Unpaid leave:** Manager + HR approval required.

## Eligibility
- Full-time employees accrue leave from day 1.
- Part-time/contractors: pro-rated where applicable.

## Request Process
1. Check team calendar and coverage.
2. Submit request in HR system with dates and type.
3. Manager approves; HR confirms balance.
4. Update OOO message and calendar.

## Documentation
- Attach medical notes for sick leave >2 days.
- Keep records for audit (12 months).

## Blackout Periods
- Critical business windows require director approval.

## Escalation
- Unresolved issues → HR Business Partner.

## Effective Date & Review
Effective immediately; reviewed annually.

title: ATP Guidelines
summary: Standard for activity tracking, reviews and performance signaling.
body:
## Overview
The Activity Tracking & Performance (ATP) process ensures work is visible, measurable, and linked to goals.

## Objectives
- Increase transparency of outcomes
- Enable fair reviews and coaching
- Feed promotion and rewards decisions

## What to Track
- **Objectives** (quarterly)
- **Outcomes** (bi-weekly summaries)
- **Evidence** (links, artifacts, metrics)

## Cadence
- Weekly: update personal log
- Bi-weekly: manager check-in
- Quarterly: formal review and calibration

## Tooling
- Work items live in project tools (Jira/Azure DevOps);
- Summaries captured in the ATP workspace.

## Ratings
- Signals: **Exceeds / Meets / Building / Off-track**

## Governance
People Ops maintains the framework; managers ensure adherence.

title: DBP Support Guidelines
summary: SOP for intake, triage, escalation and closure of DBP support.
body:
## Scope
Covers support for Digital Business Platform (DBP) incidents and requests.

## Intake Channels
- Portal form (preferred)
- Email (auto-creates ticket)
- Chat escalation (high severity only)

## Triage
1. Validate severity (S1–S4)
2. Categorize (Access, Data, Workflow, Integration)
3. Assign owner and SLA clock

## SLAs
- **S1:** 15m response / 4h restore
- **S2:** 1h response / 1 business day
- **S3–S4:** Best effort within 3 business days

## Escalation
- S1: bridge call within 15 minutes; duty manager notified
- Vendor escalation via support contract

## Closure
- Confirm resolution with requester
- Document root cause and preventive action
- Post-incident review for S1/S2

## Metrics
First response time, time to restore, reopen rate.

title: Client Session Guidelines
summary: Best practices for planning, facilitating and following-up client sessions.
body:
## Outcomes
- Shared understanding of goals and constraints
- Prioritized decisions and next steps

## Before the Session
- Define objectives, agenda, and roles (facilitator, scribe, decision owner)
- Pre-read with context and open questions
- Logistics: room, remote access, timeboxing

## During the Session
- Start with outcomes and agenda
- Use timeboxes and visible parking lot
- Encourage evidence-based decisions; note owners and dates

## After the Session
- Send a concise summary (decisions, risks, actions)
- Store artifacts in the workspace; track actions to closure

## Templates
Agenda, decision log, and action tracker are available in the toolkit.

title: Task | Azure DevOps Guidelines
summary: SOP for creating, linking and tracking tasks in Azure DevOps.
body:
## Work Item Hygiene
- Title = verb + outcome
- Acceptance criteria as bullet list
- Link to parent story/bug and PR

## Creating a Task
1. Use the team project template
2. Set iteration/sprint and area path
3. Add estimates and acceptance criteria

## Linking
- PRs and Builds must link to the work item
- Close via commit message keywords when merged

## Boards & Queries
- Use team board views for daily stand-ups
- Saved queries for triage and WIP limits

## Definition of Done
- CI passes, code reviewed, tests updated, production checks green, documentation updated

title: Blueprint Management Guidelines
summary: Process for creating, approving and versioning delivery blueprints.
body:
## Purpose
Ensure reusable delivery blueprints are high-quality, versioned, and governed.

## Lifecycle
1. **Draft**: authored by domain SME
2. **Review**: peer and PMO review
3. **Approve**: sign-off by owner
4. **Publish**: catalog entry with version tag
5. **Retire**: superseded, archived

## Versioning Rules
- SemVer (MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH)
- Changelog and migration notes required

## Quality Gates
- Customer outcomes defined
- Risks and controls identified
- Templates and metrics attached

## Ownership
- Blueprint owner maintains roadmap and reviews every 6 months

title: Agile Working Guidelines
summary: Agreed behaviors and rhythms for agile collaboration and delivery.
body:
## Principles
- Value outcomes over outputs
- Short feedback loops
- Transparent work and WIP limits

## Team Rhythms
- Daily stand-up (15 min)
- Planning (every sprint)
- Review & Retrospective (end of sprint)

## Cadence Health
- Stable velocity within ±20%
- No carry-over without explicit reason

## Collaboration Norms
- Default to public channels
- Decision logs and action owners
- Async first; meeting hygiene

title: Meetings & Sessions Optimization
summary: Principles to maximize outcomes and reduce meeting waste.
body:
## When to Meet
- Decision, alignment, risk review, or complex design
- Otherwise: async update

## Design Your Meeting
- Clear outcome
- Invite the minimum
- Timebox and agenda

## Good Practices
- Start with context and constraints
- Use a visible decision log
- End with owners and dates

## Anti-patterns
- No outcome, too many attendees, hidden decisions, no action tracking

title: DQ Scrum Guidelines
summary: Standard Scrum events, roles, artifacts and definitions of done.
body:
## Roles
Product Owner, Scrum Master, Developers

## Events & Timeboxes
- Sprint (1–4 weeks)
- Planning (max 8h for 1-month sprint)
- Daily Scrum (15m)
- Review (4h for 1-month sprint)
- Retrospective (3h for 1-month sprint)

## Artifacts
- Product Backlog with ordered items
- Sprint Backlog (sprint goal + plan)
- Increment (potentially shippable)

## DoD (Definition of Done)
- Code reviewed, tests updated, security checks pass, documentation updated, deployed to target environment

title: Stakeholder Catalog Guidelines
summary: Process for discovery, segmentation and engagement play.
body:
## Objectives
- Maintain a single view of stakeholders
- Increase engagement quality and traceability

## Steps
1. Discovery & intake (sources: CRM, projects, events)
2. Normalize and deduplicate
3. Segment (influence, interest, role)
4. Map objectives and engagement plan
5. Review quarterly and after major changes

## Governance
- Data steward assigned; audit trail required.

title: DQ Content Strategy
summary: Best practices for planning, production and distribution of content.
body:
## Goals
- Drive qualified demand and loyalty
- Educate and enable customers

## Pillars
- Audience insights → topics
- Editorial calendar → campaigns
- Distribution mix → owned/earned/paid

## Production Workflow
Brief → Outline → Draft → Review → Approve → Publish → Repurpose

## KPIs
- Consumption (views, time), engagement (CTR), conversion, assisted pipeline

## Governance
- Source of truth in the content repo; quarterly refresh

title: DQ Social Media Guidelines
summary: Policy for brand voice, approvals and conduct on social platforms.
body:
## Scope
Applies to all employees posting on behalf of the brand.

## Brand Voice
- Clear, helpful, respectful
- No confidential info or speculation

## Approval Workflow
- Draft → Brand review → Compliance check → Publish

## Responses & Escalation
- Acknowledge within 2h business time
- Escalate sensitive topics to PR/legal

## Prohibited Content
Hate speech, harassment, copyrighted material without rights.

## Security
Use approved tools and MFA; rotate credentials quarterly.

title: Visual Assets for Social Media — Design Rules
summary: Template & rules for posts, fliers and campaign visuals.
body:
## Overview
This is a downloadable template pack with usage rules.

## Use When
- Creating campaign visuals and social posts

## Key Rules
- Respect safe areas and logo usage
- Use brand palette and typography
- Export profiles: PNG for social, PDF for print

> Use the **Download Templates** button to open in the design app.

title: Proposal & Projects Commercial Guidelines
summary: Process for pricing, approvals and commercial governance.
body:
## Stages
1. Opportunity & scope confirmation
2. Pricing model selection (T&M, Fixed, Hybrid)
3. Risk & margin review
4. Approvals (deal desk)
5. Contracting and handover

## Controls
- Standard terms preferred
- Non-standard clauses require legal review
- Pricing assumptions documented

## KPIs
Win rate, cycle time, realized margin vs. plan

title: DQ Forum Guidelines
summary: SOP for creating, moderating and resolving forum threads.
body:
## Purpose
Keep forums constructive, searchable, and resolved.

## Creating a Thread
- Clear title and context
- One question per thread

## Moderation
- Tag correctly; merge duplicates
- Move off-topic posts
- Enforce code of conduct

## Resolution
- Mark accepted answer
- Summarize solution for future search

## Escalation
- Abuse → report to moderators; severe issues → HR/Legal
